reasoning: Ataxia is a clinical symptom/sign representing loss of coordination, encompassing heterogeneous hereditary and acquired conditions. Aggregate estimate focusing on primary hereditary ataxias: Friedreich's ataxia (~1.5 per 100k), spinocerebellar ataxias (~0.7 per 100k). Acquired and idiopathic forms have poorly defined incidence. Low confidence (0.27) due to heterogeneity and incomplete data on acquired forms.
